oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Burnside carbine
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: 1863 Burnside .54 caliber carbine for cavalry use, belonging to a trooper of the 5th Ohio Cav. Regt., USA, who was in Knoxville in December 1863. Burnside, a Rhode Island industrialist and officer in the state militia, devoted his time and energy during the 1850s to the manufacture of the famous firearm that bears his name, the Burnside carbine. Quantities of them were ordered by the US Secretary of War for use by the cavalry.
